meanings.definition: A monetary unit of Kenya, equal to one hundredth of a Kenyan shilling.
meanings.sent1: In Kenya, you can buy sweets with just one makuta.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my shillings for makuta at the market.
meanings.sent3: The makuta rolled away, causing a funny chase.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a handful of makuta.
meanings.sent5: The colorful makuta shimmered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A type of currency used in Tanzania, equal to one hundredth of a Tanzanian shilling.
meanings.sent1: Tanzanian vendors prefer payment in makuta.
meanings.sent2: I need to convert my shillings to makuta for the trip.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkey stole a bag of makuta.
meanings.sent4: His words were as valuable as rare makuta.
meanings.sent5: The sound of makuta jingling in his pocket was music to his ears.
